abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Social Safety Net
            Adjustment Loan Project is rated as satisfactory,
            sustainability as unlikely, institutional development impact
            as modest, Bank performance as satisfactory, and borrower
            performance as unsatisfactory. Issues with NGO engagement
            affect the implementation and outcome of the project. The
            key lesson learned from this project is that adjustment
            loans of sufficient magnitude to have macroeconomic
            consequences are very high profile, and hence are a very
            problematic instrument for institutional changes. Avoiding
            multiple tranche operations in volatile environments is
            recommended Bank practice now. Adjustment loans that require
            cross-sectoral implementation by line ministries will be
            complicated. Avoid adjustment loans with process conditions
            wherever possible. Consultations should be done very early
            in the loan preparation, where process is a necessary part
            of the condition. Avoid cofinancing of second tranches.
